page.title: 17ECOLOGY OF WESTON.
page.content: {Wild flowers}can be found in the hedgerows, Cow Parsley grows in profusion in the summer months; Daisy, Nettles, Dandelion, Buttercup, Poppy and Speedwell also appear. Many{trees have been planted in an effort to encourage{conservation.}Around the school perimeter there is Hawthorn and by the factory Limes. A Willow tree stands by the pond as do Horse Chestnuts. Most of the Elms were destroyed by Dutch Elm Disease but the stumps left are now sprouting. Other species noted include Peach, Plum, Oak, Apple, Elder, Hazel, Ash, Holly and Sycamore.{Wild animals}can often easily be seen, including rabbits, hares, mice, Muncjac deer, hedgehogs, stoats, weasels, fox and badgers. There are ducks on the pond and plenty of pheasants and quail in the fields. Owls and bats can be seen at night.
